name: Ims-lti
tagline: A Ruby library to help implement IMS LTI tool consumers and providers (MIL Fork adds new data extensions)
body:
### MIL-IMS-LTI
This is the Middlebury Interactive Languages fork of the [Instructure IMS-LTI](https://github.com/instructure/ims-lti) gem.  It adds a new outcome data type that allows instructors to have instructor graded assignments within the [Middlebury platform](http://www.middleburyinteractive.com) on any LMS through LTI.

## Problem
Submitting a grade through LTI will have it graded immediately.  This prevents an instructor from having a chance to see a list of submissions that `need grading` and giving each student a grade
based on the students work for an `essay` or `audio` submission etc.

## Solution
Adding a new outcome data extension key/value pair that will allow a submission to be marked as needs grading.  This prevents the LMS from grading the assignment and allows the instructor to review it first and give it a grade accordingly.

## Usage

First create a tool provider with the OutcomeData extensions:

```ruby
	tp = IMS::LTI::ToolProvider.new(consumer_key, shared_secret, lti_params)
    tp.extend IMS::LTI::Extensions::OutcomeData::ToolProvider 
```

Next check the lms for support and use post_replace_result_with_data with the new `needs_grading` param:

```ruby
	if tp.accepts_outcome_needs_grading? 
    	tp.post_replace_result_with_data!(score_lti,'needs_grading' => 'true')
   	end
```

Optionally use url to give the instructor a link to the students work for grading:

```ruby
	if tp.accepts_outcome_needs_grading? && tp.accepts_outcome_url?
    	tp.post_replace_result_with_data!(
    		score_lti,
    		'needs_grading' => 'true',
    		'url' => 'http://www.example.com/assignment/student_id'
    	)
   	end
```

## Add this gem to your project

```
$ gem install mil-ims-lti
```

```ruby
	# Gemfile
	gem 'mil-ims-lti', '~> 1.1.6'
```

## Requires LMS implementation
Each LMS will need to implement and accept the `needs_grading` data type then use this value when present to prevent grading from happening on a submission recieved from LTI. This modification has been made to the [MIL fork of Canvas](https://github.com/SpeakEZ/canvas-lms) as an example.

### Authors and Contributors
This was added by the Middlebury Interactive Languages Development team.
